p: Despite the large amount of research being conducted on the effects of climate change on animals, many important questions remain without clear answers. Which climate change effects are most prevalent? Are those effects negative, neutral or positive for the species? Are the effects generalizable across regions and taxa? Are there biases in study design that might influence the conclusions? Are there taxa, regions and questions on which future research should focus? Systematic reviews—the combined analysis of the results of different studies—enable us to answer some of those questions by determining if results of single studies are consistent across regions and taxa [ 14].
